item.title: Jake add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Jake add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Jake add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jake add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "No human being, when you understand his desires, is worthless. No one's life is nothing. Even the most evil of men and women, if you understand their hearts, had some generous act that redeems them, at least a little, from their sins." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Jake add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "It's so hard to forget pain, but it's even harder to remember sweetness. We have no scar to show for happiness. We learn so little from peace." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jake add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Leonardo's Mona Lisa is just a thousand thousand smears of paint. Michelangelo's David is just a million hits with a hammer. We're all of us a million bits put together the right way." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jake add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "If emotion can create a physical action, then duplicating the physical action can re-create the emotion." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jake add a quote by Stanisław Lem
item.description: "We have no need of other worlds. We need mirrors. We don't know what to do with other worlds. A single world, our own, suffices us; but we can't accept it for what it is." -- Stanisław Lem

item.title: Jake add a quote by Stanisław Lem
item.description: "The fate of a single man can be rich with significance, that of a few hundred less so, but the history of thousands and millions of men does not mean anything at all, in any adequate sense of the word." -- Stanisław Lem

item.title: Jake add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "We may have been crazed, strange and entirely too eager to find new things to have sex with - but we went out to preserve great chunks of this planet's cultures and we damned well did it with some style" -- Warren Ellis

item.title: Jake add a quote by Keith Miller
item.description: "And he loves to read. He loves the whisper of the pages and the way his fingertips catch on rough paper, the pour of the words up from the leaves, through soft light, into his eyes, the mute voice in his ears." -- Keith Miller

item.title: Jake add a quote by Keith Miller
item.description: "Conversations in the flesh are the first drafts toward the later conversations of the mind, where words and ideas are sorted and elaborated, recast." -- Keith Miller

item.title: Jake add a quote by Keith Miller
item.description: "Memories must enter the bloodstream, must churn awhile through the heart's mill, must be crushed and polished, be nearly forgotten or cling like burs to other stories before they spill forth in purple patterns, shapes of small bones and worm rot, shapes of clouds and the spaces between leaves." -- Keith Miller

item.title: Jake add a quote by Keith Miller
item.description: "A forest is mystery but the desert is truth. Life pared to the bone." -- Keith Miller

item.title: Jake add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "almost any object, including this book you hold, can turn up as Exhibit A in a murder trial." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Jake add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Every now and then when your life gets complicated and the weasels start closing in, the only cure is to load up on heinous chemicals and then drive like a bastard from Hollywood to Las Vegas ... with the music at top volume and at least a pint of ether." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Jake add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "So, throughout life, our worst weaknesses and meannesses are usually committed for the sake of the people whom we most despise." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Jake add a quote by William Makepeace Thackeray
item.description: "if you are not allowed to touch the heart sometimes in spite of syntax, and are not to be loved until you all know the difference between trimeter and trameter, may all Poetry go to the deuce, and every schoolmaster perish miserably!" -- William Makepeace Thackeray

item.title: Jake add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Jake add a quote by Terence McKenna
item.description: "It is not easy to measure the ocean, but we can be measured by it, confront it, and be in it." -- Terence McKenna

item.title: Jake add a quote by Thomas C. Foster
item.description: "When it's over, we may feel wooed, adored, appreciated, or abused, but it will have been an affair to remember." -- Thomas C. Foster

item.title: Jake add a quote by Thomas C. Foster
item.description: "The novels we read allow us to encounter possible persons, visions of ourselves that we would never see, never permit ourselves to become, in places we can never go and might not care to, while assuring that we get to return home again." -- Thomas C. Foster

item.title: Jake add a quote by Jonathan Goldstein
item.description: "What is it about legs? Or what is it about breasts? Or the small of the back? What is it about anything? One day there will be no difference between anything. It'll all be the exact same thing. One day you'll look in the dictionary and there will be only one word and you'll just have to make do." -- Jonathan Goldstein

item.title: Jake add a quote by Ammon Shea
item.description:
"Charientism (n.) A rhetorical term to describe saying a disagreeable thing in an agreeable way.
If I knew how to say disagreeable things in an agreeable fashion I most likely would not be spending most of my time siting alone in a room, reading the dictionary." -- Ammon Shea

item.title: Jake add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Jake add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Faith is taking the first step even when you can't see the whole staircase." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Jake add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "If a man is called to be a street sweeper, he should sweep streets even as a Michaelangelo painted, or Beethoven composed music or Shakespeare wrote poetry. He should sweep streets so well that all the hosts of heaven and earth will pause to say, 'Here lived a great street sweeper who did his job well." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Jake add a quote by Hugh Prather
item.description: "I don't need a "reason" to be happy. I don't have to consult the future to know how happy I feel now." -- Hugh Prather

item.title: Jake add a quote by Howard Jacobson
item.description: "He let himself be storm-tossed, riding her billowing sea. When she held him like this he could see nothing, but the colour of his blindness was the colour of waves breaking" -- Howard Jacobson

item.title: Jake add a quote by Colson Whitehead
item.description: "We never see other people anyway, only the monsters we make of them." -- Colson Whitehead
